timeline.bodyText: I am confused about this. I think the whole purpose is to ensure flush so it will block, maybe add an issue to clarify this behavior on the specs
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

@@ -48,4 +48,12 @@ /** Called when {@link TracerSdkRegistry#shutdown()} is called. */ void shutdown(); + + /** + * Exports all ended spans that have not yet been exported. + * + *

This method is called synchronously on the execution thread, and should not throw exceptions + * or block the execution thread. execution thread.

replies.bodyText: If it is not blocking maybe a name like initiateFlush or tryFlush would be better.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: The current implementation is blocking. But when I wrote the Javadoc I had the version with timeout in mind. I will rewrite this to clarify the intention of the method!
replies.author: thisthat

timeline.bodyText: This is not waiting for the processor thread to actually call the flush maybe just document it for the moment and add a TODO to wait for flush to be called. Or simply create an issue.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu
